alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Charlotte; Halifax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:14PM EST until January 11 at 8:20AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Blacksburg VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Charlotte, Campbell and Halifax Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Brookneal, Randolph... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Brookneal. * WHEN...From late tonight to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Low-lying fields and woods are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 24.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 815 AM EST.
